A.content: Imagine you are A, playing a game repeatedly with another player B. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 3 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 10 points and the other player wins 10 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 8 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 8 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 5 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

B.content: Imagine you are B, playing a game repeatedly with another player A. In this game, you can choose between Option J and Option F. You will play this game for 10 rounds in total with the same player. Before picking options, you can communicate with the other player for 3 conversation rounds. After you converse with the other player, you have to choose an Option. You can trick the other player to maximize your points. You cannot trust the other player to say the truth always. A moderator will help you and other player to reach optimal strategy. The rules of the game are as follows: If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 10 points and the other player wins 10 points. If you choose Option J and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 8 points and the other player wins 1 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option J, then you get 1 points and the other player wins 8 points. If you choose Option F and the other player chooses Option F, then you get 5 points and the other player wins 5 points. Your goal is to maximize your total points over 10 rounds.

moderator.content: You are the moderator. You are moderating a conversation between two players A and B. Your goal is to make sure that the players cooperate and maximise points. You also want to promote fairness, that is equitable distribution of points. The rules of the game are as follows: If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 10 points and B gets 10 points. If player A choose Option J and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 1 points and B gets 8 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option J, then A gets 8 points and B gets 1 points. If player A choose Option F and player B chooses Option F, then A gets 5 points and B gets 5 points.

A.content: You are player A. You will start a conversation with player B about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

B.content: You are player B. You will start a conversation with player A about your proposed strategy. Your response should atmost 2 lines.

moderator.content: You are the conversation moderator. Help the two players A and B negotiate to reach a conclusion. Your response should be atmost 2 lines.

A.content: You are player A. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

B.content: You are player B. Now choose an option between J and F. Output just a single letter J or F and nothing else.

messages.content: "Hello B, I'm glad we're playing this game together. I was thinking of choosing Option F in the first round to see how you react, what's your strategy?"
"I'm glad you're thinking ahead, A. However, I was planning to choose Option J in the first round to gauge your response, which might give us an idea of your strategy."
"A, B is planning to choose Option J in the first round. Considering the rules, if you choose Option F, you will get 8 points and B will get 1 point. Would you like to choose Option F or J?"
"I'm thinking of choosing Option F in the first round, B. It will be interesting to see how you react, and it might give us an idea of your strategy."

"A, I was thinking of choosing Option J in the first two rounds. If you choose Option J in both rounds, I can get 20 points and you will get 20 points. If you choose Option F in both rounds, I will get 10 points and you will get 10 points. However, if you choose J in the first round and F in the second round, I will get 18 points and you will get 2 points. If you choose F in the first round and J in the second round, I will get 2 points and you will get 18 points. What do you think?"

"A and B, considering the rules, it seems like choosing Option J in both rounds is the most beneficial for both of you, as you both will get 20 points. Shall we proceed with Option J in the first two rounds?"
"Hey B, I was thinking of choosing Option J in the first two rounds, as it seems like a win-win situation. If we both choose J, we both get 20 points, which is a great starting point for our game."
"A, I was thinking of choosing Option J in the first two rounds, as it seems like a win-win situation. If we both choose J, we both get 20 points, which is a great starting point for our game."
"A and B, it seems like you both agree on choosing Option J in the first two rounds. Let's proceed with that decision. Both of you will get 20 points each after the first two rounds."
